p: CoVs utilize specific host factors for virus entry and replication. Specific monoclonal or polyclonal antibodies, peptides or functional inhibitors can target the host receptor. For example, anti-DPP4 mAbs inhibit MERS-CoV cell entry in vitro [147]. For the treatment of SARS-CoV, small-molecule entry inhibitors such as N-(2-aminoethyl)-1-aziridineethanamine (93, NAAE) inhibit the catalytic activity of ACE2 and SARS-CoV S-mediated cell-cell fusion in vitro [148].
